name: Ginger Shrimp with Fried Rice
author: HAYMOREEW
summary: My husband and I love Ginger Shrimp. I fix it often and have many   requests for the recipe.  Served with green beans and red peppers, it is  always a hit at mealtime!
ingredients: ¼ cup whole kernel corn, drained
¾ pound cooked shrimp - peeled and deveined
directions: In a saucepan bring water to a boil
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes
In a large skillet over high heat, add sesame oil and allow it to get hot
Add rice and 1 tablespoon of butter
Stir in the snow peas and corn
Saute until rice begins to brown slightly
Add shrimp to top of rice
Reduce heat to low and cover to keep warm
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the orange and lime juices, onion, honey, ginger root and garlic
Spoon enough of the mixture to coat the shrimp
In a saucepan over high heat, combine the remaining juice mixture with chicken broth and cornstarch
Bring to a boil and reduce heat
Serve over the rice and shrimp
